verses.kjv: And Elijah the Tishbite, who was of the inhabitants of Gilead, said unto Ahab, As the LORD God of Israel liveth, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew nor rain these years, but according to my word.
verses.ct: Elijah the Tishbite, from the settlers of Gilead, told Ahab, "As surely as the LORD God of Israel lives, the one I serve, there will be no dew or rain in the coming years unless I say so."

verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto him, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to him:

verses.kjv: Get thee hence, and turn thee eastward, and hide thyself by the brook Cherith, that is before Jordan.
verses.ct: "Leave this place and head east. Hide yourself by the brook Cherith, east of the Jordan."

verses.kjv: And it shall be, that thou shalt drink of the brook; and I have commanded the ravens to feed thee there.
verses.ct: "You will drink from the brook, and I have ordered the ravens to bring you food there."

verses.kjv: So he went and did according unto the word of the LORD: for he went and dwelt by the brook Cherith, that is before Jordan.
verses.ct: So he did what the LORD told him. He went and stayed by the brook Cherith, east of the Jordan.

verses.kjv: And the ravens brought him bread and flesh in the morning, and bread and flesh in the evening; and he drank of the brook.
verses.ct: The ravens brought him bread and meat every morning and bread and meat every evening, and he drank from the brook.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after a while, that the brook dried up, because there had been no rain in the land.
verses.ct: But after some time, the brook dried up because there had been no rain anywhere in the land.

verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto him, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to him again:

verses.kjv: Arise, get thee to Zarephath, which belongeth to Zidon, and dwell there: behold, I have commanded a widow woman there to sustain thee.
verses.ct: "Get up and go to Zarephath, which belongs to Sidon, and stay there. I have directed a widow in that town to provide for you."

verses.kjv: So he arose and went to Zarephath. And when he came to the gate of the city, behold, the widow woman was there gathering of sticks: and he called to her, and said, Fetch me, I pray thee, a little water in a vessel, that I may drink.
verses.ct: So he got up and went to Zarephath. When he arrived at the town gate, a widow was there collecting sticks. He called out to her, "Please, would you bring me a little water in a cup so I can have a drink?"

verses.kjv: And as she was going to fetch it, he called to her, and said, Bring me, I pray thee, a morsel of bread in thine hand.
verses.ct: As she was going to get it, he called after her, "Please bring me a piece of bread too."

verses.kjv: And she said, As the LORD thy God liveth, I have not a cake, but an handful of meal in a barrel, and a little oil in a cruse: and, behold, I am gathering two sticks, that I may go in and dress it for me and my son, that we may eat it, and die.
verses.ct: She replied, "As surely as the LORD your God lives, I don't have any bread — just a handful of flour in a jar and a small amount of oil in a jug. Right now I'm gathering a couple of sticks so I can go home and prepare it for myself and my son. We'll eat that last meal, and then we'll starve."

verses.kjv: And Elijah said unto her, Fear not; go and do as thou hast said: but make me thereof a little cake first, and bring it unto me, and after make for thee and for thy son.
verses.ct: Elijah said to her, "Don't be afraid. Go ahead and do what you planned, but first make a small loaf for me and bring it out. After that, make something for yourself and your son."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD God of Israel, The barrel of meal shall not waste, neither shall the cruse of oil fail, until the day that the LORD sendeth rain upon the earth.
verses.ct: "Because this is what the LORD God of Israel says: The jar of flour will not run out, and the jug of oil will not go empty until the day the LORD sends rain on the land."

verses.kjv: And she went and did according to the saying of Elijah: and she, and he, and her house, did eat many days.
verses.ct: She went and did what Elijah told her. And she, Elijah, and her household had food to eat for many days.

verses.kjv: And the barrel of meal wasted not, neither did the cruse of oil fail, according to the word of the LORD, which he spake by Elijah.
verses.ct: The jar of flour never ran out, and the jug of oil never went empty, just as the LORD had promised through Elijah.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, fell sick; and his sickness was so sore, that there was no breath left in him.
verses.ct: Some time later, the son of the woman who owned the house became sick. His illness grew worse and worse until he finally stopped breathing.

verses.kjv: And she said unto Elijah, What have I to do with thee, O thou man of God? art thou come unto me to call my sin to remembrance, and to slay my son?
verses.ct: She said to Elijah, "What do you have against me, man of God? Did you come here to remind God of my sin and cause my son to die?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, Give me thy son. And he took him out of her bosom, and carried him up into a loft, where he abode, and laid him upon his own bed.
verses.ct: He told her, "Give me your son." He took the boy from her arms, carried him up to the upper room where he was staying, and laid him on his own bed.

verses.kjv: And he cried unto the LORD, and said, O LORD my God, hast thou also brought evil upon the widow with whom I sojourn, by slaying her son?
verses.ct: Then he cried out to the LORD, "LORD my God, have you brought tragedy even on this widow I'm staying with by letting her son die?"

verses.kjv: And he stretched himself upon the child three times, and cried unto the LORD, and said, O LORD my God, I pray thee, let this child’s soul come into him again.
verses.ct: He stretched himself over the child 3 times and cried out to the LORD, "LORD my God, please let this child's soul return to him!"

verses.kjv: And the LORD heard the voice of Elijah; and the soul of the child came into him again, and he revived.
verses.ct: The LORD heard Elijah's prayer, and the child's soul returned to him, and he came back to life.

verses.kjv: And Elijah took the child, and brought him down out of the chamber into the house, and delivered him unto his mother: and Elijah said, See, thy son liveth.
verses.ct: Elijah picked up the child, carried him down from the upper room into the house, and gave him to his mother. Elijah said, "Look — your son is alive!"

verses.kjv: And the woman said to Elijah, Now by this I know that thou art a man of God, and that the word of the LORD in thy mouth is truth.
verses.ct: The woman told Elijah, "Now I know for certain that you truly are a man of God, and that the word of the LORD that you speak is the truth."
